main.name: Page Black
main.description: I am a registered-nurse turned web-developer, looking to combine my health-knowledge with my love of technology to ideally make the world at least a bit better
main.bio: If this last year has taught us anything, it's that we need more medical professionals in every industry, not just healthcare. I'm excited to begin my transition into the world of computer science and continue developing my skills within more professional settings. I have experience with Javascript, React, Node/Express, JQuery, MySQL, NoSQL, Python, and even a bit of C#.
main.contactmessage: I'd love to hear from you!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Six month "bootcamp" styled program with multiple solo and group projects, using: Javascript, React, Node, Express, MySQL, & NoSQL. Served as Project Manager for two group-projects containing four other students.
Nursing school with an emphasis on critical thinking, leadership, and research. During my time here I wrote the position paper on Workplace Violence for the Washington State Nurses Association

work.title: Developer
work.description: Complete reconfiguration of the new employee onboarding process and portal, all done with a ASP.NET framework

work.title: Registered Nurse
work.description: Bedside nurse in a fast-paced post-operative and medical-unit. Collaberate with a multidisciplinary team to delivery high-quality, evidence based interventions to adult patients. Participated and served as "tech guru" for multiple committees and programs, including the Evidence Based Practice Committee and Unit Based Education Champion
